meanings.definition: The vertical surface forming the side of a structure or vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The sidewalk was painted with colorful designs all along the sidewall of the building.
meanings.sent2: The car crashed into the sidewall of the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the sidewall of the house but slipped and fell comically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a sidewall, strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the sidewall of the school made it stand out from the rest of the buildings.

meanings.definition: The outer wall of a pneumatic tire.
meanings.sent1: The sidewall of the tire was scuffed from hitting the curb.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the sidewall of your tires for the recommended pressure.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran along the sidewall of the tire like it was a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: The tire's sidewall provided the necessary flexibility for a smooth ride.
meanings.sent5: The sidewall of the tire absorbed the impact of the pothole, preventing damage to the rim.
